member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.R_REGISTER
member.summary: Read command and status registers. AAAAA = 5 bit Register Map Address

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.W_REGISTER
member.summary: Write command and status registers. AAAAA = 5 bit Register Map Address Executable in power down or standby modes only.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.R_RX_PAYLOAD
member.summary: Read RX-payload: 1 – 32 bytes. A read operation always starts at byte 0. Payload is deleted from FIFO after it is read.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.W_TX_PAYLOAD
member.summary: Write TX-payload: 1 – 32 bytes. A write operation always starts at byte 0 used in TX payload.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.FLUSH_TX
member.summary: Flush TX FIFO, used in TX mode

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.FLUSH_RX
member.summary: Flush RX FIFO, used in RX mode Should not be executed during transmission of acknowledge, that is, acknowledge package will not be completed.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.REUSE_TX_PL
member.summary: Used for a PTX device Reuse last transmitted payload. TX payload reuse is active until W_TX_PAYLOAD or FLUSH TX is executed. TX payload reuse must not be activated or deactivated during package transmission.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.R_RX_PL_WID
member.summary: Read RX payload width for the top R_RX_PAYLOADin the RX FIFO.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.W_ACK_PAYLOAD
member.summary: Used in RX mode. Write Payload to be transmitted together with ACK packet on PIPE PPP. (PPP valid in the range from 000 to 101). Maximum three ACK packet payloads can be pending. Payloads with same PPP are handled using first in - first out principle. Write payload: 1– 32 bytes. A write operation always starts at byte 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.W_TX_PAYLOAD_NO_ACK
member.summary: Used in TX mode. Disables AUTOACK on this specific packet.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands.NOP
member.summary: No Operation. Might be used to read the STATUS register

member.name: T:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Commands
member.summary: Commands for

member.name: T:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.AddressWidth
member.summary: Address width option for

member.name: T:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.dbPower
member.summary: Power option for

member.name: T:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.RFSpeed
member.summary: Speed option for

member.name: T:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.Registers
member.summary: Registers for

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.MASK_RX_DR
member.summary: Mask interrupt caused by RX_DR 1: Interrupt not reflected on the IRQ pin 0: Reflect RX_DR as active low interrupt on the IRQpin

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.MASK_TX_DS
member.summary: Mask interrupt caused by TX_DS 1: Interrupt not reflected on the IRQ pin 0: Reflect TX_DSas active low interrupt on the IRQ pin

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.MASK_MAX_RT
member.summary: Mask interrupt caused by MAX_RT 1: Interrupt not reflected on the IRQ pin 0: Reflect MAX_RTas active low interrupt on the IRQ pin

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.EN_CRC
member.summary: Enable CRC. Forced high if one of the bits in the EN_AA is high

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.CRCO
member.summary: CRC encoding scheme '0' - 1 Byte '1' – 2 Bytes

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.PWR_UP
member.summary: 1: POWER UP, 0:POWER DOWN

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.PRIM_RX
member.summary: RX/TX control 1: PRX, 0: PTX

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ENAA_P5
member.summary: Enable auto acknowledgement data pipe 5

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ENAA_P4
member.summary: Enable auto acknowledgement data pipe 4

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ENAA_P3
member.summary: Enable auto acknowledgement data pipe 3

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ENAA_P2
member.summary: Enable auto acknowledgement data pipe 2

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ENAA_P1
member.summary: Enable auto acknowledgement data pipe 1

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ENAA_P0
member.summary: Enable auto acknowledgement data pipe 0

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ERX_P5
member.summary: Enable data pipe 5.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ERX_P4
member.summary: Enable data pipe 4.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ERX_P3
member.summary: Enable data pipe 3.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ERX_P2
member.summary: Enable data pipe 2.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ERX_P1
member.summary: Enable data pipe 1.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ERX_P0
member.summary: Enable data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.AW_LOW
member.summary: RX/TX Address field width '00' - Illegal '01' - 3 Bytes '10' - 4 Bytes '11' – 5 Bytes

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.AW_HIGH
member.summary: RX/TX Address field width '00' - Illegal '01' - 3 Bytes '10' - 4 Bytes '11' – 5 Bytes

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ARD
member.summary: Auto Retransmit Delay

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ARC
member.summary: Auto Retransmit Count

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.CONT_WAVE
member.summary: Enables continuous carrier transmit when high

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.PLL_LOCK
member.summary: Force PLL lock signal. Only used in test

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RF_PWR_LOW
member.summary: Set RF output power in TX mode Low Bit '00' – -18dBm '01' – -12dBm '10' – -6dBm '11' – 0dBm

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RF_PWR_HIGH
member.summary: Set RF output power in TX mode High Bit '00' – -18dBm '01' – -12dBm '10' – -6dBm '11' – 0dBm

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RX_DR
member.summary: Data Ready RX FIFO interrupt. Asserted when new data arrives RX FIFO

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.TX_DS
member.summary: Data Sent TX FIFO interrupt. Asserted when packet transmitted on TX. If AUTO_ACKis activated, this bit is set high only when ACK is received.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.MAX_RT
member.summary: Maximum number of TX retransmits interrupt Write 1 to clear bit. If MAX_RTis asserted it must be cleared to enable further communication.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RX_P_NO
member.summary: Data pipe number for the payload available for reading from RX_FIFO 000-101: Data Pipe Number 110: Not Used 111: RX FIFO Empty

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.TX_FULL
member.summary: TX FIFO full flag. 1: TX FIFO full. 0: Available locations in TX FIFO.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.PLOS_CNT
member.summary: Count lost packets. The counter is overflow protected to 15, and discontinues at max until reset. The counter is reset by writing to RF_CH.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.ARC_CNT
member.summary: Count retransmitted packets. The counter is reset when transmission of a new packet starts.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RPD
member.summary: Received Power Detector. This register is called CD (Carrier Detect) in the nRF24L01. The name is different in nRF24L01+ due to the different input power level threshold for this bit.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.TX_REUSE
member.summary: Used for a PTX device Pulse the rfce high for at least 10µs to Reuse last transmitted payload. TX payload reuse is active until W_TX_PAYLOADor FLUSH TXis executed. TX_REUSE is set by the SPI command REUSE_TX_PL, and is reset by the SPI commands W_TX_PAYLOAD or FLUSH TX

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.FIFO_FULL
member.summary: TX FIFO full flag. 1: TX FIFO full. 0: Available locations in TX FIFO.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.TX_EMPTY
member.summary: TX FIFO empty flag. 1: TX FIFO empty. 0: Data in TX FIFO.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RX_FULL
member.summary: RX FIFO full flag. 1: RX FIFO full. 0: Available locations in RX FIFO.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.RX_EMPTY
member.summary: RX FIFO empty flag. 1: RX FIFO empty. 0: Data in RX FIFO.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.DPL_P5
member.summary: Enable dynamic payload length data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.DPL_P4
member.summary: Enable dynamic payload length data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.DPL_P3
member.summary: Enable dynamic payload length data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.DPL_P2
member.summary: Enable dynamic payload length data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.DPL_P1
member.summary: Enable dynamic payload length data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.DPL_P0
member.summary: Enable dynamic payload length data pipe 0.

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.EN_DPL
member.summary: Enables Dynamic Payload Length

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.EN_ACK_PAY
member.summary: Enables Payload with ACK

member.name: F:IS_nRF24L01p.Common.BitFlags.EN_DYN_ACK
member.summary: Enables the W_TX_PAYLOAD_NOACK command

member.name: T:IS_nRF24L01p.Common
member.summary: Provide access to global definition

member.name: E:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.OnDataReceived
member.summary: Occurs when data is received.

member.name: E:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.OnDataReceiveFailed
member.summary: Occurs when data is received with bad payload.

member.name: E:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.OnTransmitFailed
member.summary: Occurs when data is received.

member.name: E:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.OnTransmitSuccess
member.summary: Occurs when data is successfully transmitted.

member.name: P:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.ChannelFreq
member.summary: RF channel frequency. It determines the center of the channel used by the nRF24L01p. Number from 0 to 125 are allowed.

member.name: P:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.AddressWidth
member.summary: RF address width.

member.name: P:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.dbPower
member.summary: RF db Power

member.name: P:IS_nRF24L01p.nRF24L01P.Speed
member.summary: RF Speed
